alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 4:03AM MST until January 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 to 4 feet, with local amounts up to 5 feet possible over the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph until Saturday night. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible mountain travel due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation will be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can easily become disoriented in near whiteout conditions, and could become lost or stranded.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
